item.title: Jesus H Christ
item.description: Most viral edit: Thanks for the upvotes and accolades. I should have included a news article about the arrest, my bad. He was arrested as part of a sex trafficking operation. Here’s a quick summary: https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/bloomington-police-arrest-30-human-191210953.html Original post: https://bsky.app/profile/atrupar.com/post/3mejugdtqms2c Sorry I had to cut off 6 seconds. Imgur video upload hates me. Abolish every fucking 3 letter govt agency in charge of our security. Fuck the DHS, Fuck ICE, Fuck the FBI, Fuck the DEA, Fuck the TSA, Fuck whatever else I’m too mad to recall. 9/11 broke the already fragile brains of our national security apparatus and every single expert ringing the alarms bells about these agencies has been proven correct (I shouldn’t have to clarify that this criticism excludes whatever the fascist pasty has to say). The ever expanding scope of surveillance, ballooning budgets, violations of federal and state laws, violations of constitutional rights, construction of modern concentration camps, dystopian security contracts with tech companies, and outright fucking murder of Americans and immigrants, etc etc has made America more unsafe than it was before the agencies had god like powers. Power corrupts, and the US security state has completed a speed run of that phrase.

item.title: Sweden beats USA, for gold
item.description:
Sweden won Olympic gold in curling mixed double after an even match against the US.
The Wranå siblings had nerves of Ice, winning with the last stone.
Rasmus has played in the Olympics three times now. Silver with the men's team 2018, gold with the same team 2022 and now another gold. And he will play for the men's team as well this year.
Isabella was a monster, 97% accuracy
So nice to beat the US. Eat shit, Trump

item.title: Despicable. ICE trying fill their quota by illegal and fraudulent deportations. Forging signatures, etc.
item.description: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/09/irish-man-seamus-culleton-ice-detention An Irish man has spent five months in US Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention and faces deportation despite having a valid work permit and no criminal record. Seamus Culleton was a “model immigrant” who had become the victim of a capricious and inept system, said his lawyer, Ogor Winnie Okoye. Originally from County Kilkenny, Culleton is married to a US citizen and runs a plastering business in the Boston area. While buying supplies at a hardware store on 9 September 2025 he was arrested in a random immigration sweep, according to Okoye, of BOS Legal Group in Massachusetts. Culleton entered the US in 2009 on a visa waiver programme and overstayed the 90 day-limit but, after marrying a US citizen and applying for lawful permanent residence, he obtained a statutory exemption that allowed him to work, Okoye told the Guardian. “He had a work-approved authorisation that is tied to a green card application,” she said. Culleton’s detention prevented him from attending the final interview in October, she said. “It’s inexplicable that this man has been in detention. It does not make sense. There’s no reason why the government shouldn’t just release him and allow him to attend the interview that will confirm his legal status.” After being held in ICE facilities near Boston and in Buffalo, New York, he was flown to a facility in El Paso, Texas, where he is sharing a cell with more than 70 men. Culleton said the detention centre was cold, damp and squalid, and there were fights over insufficient food – “like a concentration camp, absolute hell”, he told the Irish Times, which first reported the story on Monday. Culleton said that when he was arrested he was carrying a Massachusetts driving licence and a valid work permit issued as part of an application for a green card that he initiated in April 2025. He has a final interview remaining. When asked at the Buffalo facility to sign a form agreeing to deportation, Culleton said he refused and instead ticked a box expressing a wish to contest his arrest, which he intended to do on the grounds that he was married to a US citizen, Tiffany Smyth, and had a valid work permit. At a November hearing a judge approved his release on a $4,000 bond, which Smyth paid, but authorities continued to detain Culleton, initially without explanation. When his attorney appealed to a federal court, two ICE agents said that in Buffalo Culleton had signed documents agreeing to be deported. Culleton said he did not agree and that the signatures were not his. “My whole life is here. I worked so hard to build my business. My wife is here.” The judge noted irregularities in ICE’s court documents but sided with the agency. Under US law Culleton cannot appeal but he wants handwriting experts to examine the signatures and believes a video of his interview with ICE in Buffalo would prove he refused to sign deportation documents. Previous high-profile cases involving people from Ireland include Cliona Ward, who had a green card but was detained by ICE for 17 days over a criminal record from more than 20 years ago. A visiting Irish tech worker who overstayed his visa by three days and agreed to deportation was jailed for about 100 days. Culleton told the Irish Times he did not know what would happen next and that the uncertainty was “psychological torture”. Facility officials tried to get him to sign a deportation order last week but he refused, he said. Okoye said the US government had discretionary power to release her client and was acting in an inept and capricious manner towards an immigrant who was following the green card process. “He’s never been arrested. He’s married to a US citizen. He owns his own business. He’s established a life here. He’s done everything right.” Smyth said she had endured five months of heartbreak, stress, anxiety and anger. “I would never wish this on anyone or their family. I am still praying for a miracle every day.” After a video call with her husband on Sunday night – their first in five months – Smyth told Culleton’s family in Ireland he had lost weight and hair and had sores and infections. “There’s no hygiene there. He’s been asking for antibiotics for the last four weeks,” his sister, Caroline Culleton, told RTÉ. The detainees were seldom allowed out for exercise or air, she said. “It’s heartbreaking. We’ve talked about what he endures physically but what about his mental health? How will he deal with this when he gets out? What long-term effect it has on him?” Last week the Irish government said the number of Irish citizens seeking consular assistance about deportation from the US jumped from 15 in 2024 to 65 last year.

item.title: Hint: Its the rise of fascism
item.description: Optimism among U.S. adults has sunk to a record low, according to a new Gallup survey. The poll, released Tuesday, found that less than six in 10 respondents anticipate high-quality lives in five years as of 2025. That marks the lowest rating on the subject since Gallup began surveying Americans on it in 2009 and a drop of 9.1 percentage points since 2020. Optimism dropped from 68.3 percent that year to 67.7 percent in 2021 and 63.1 percent in 2022, amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The metric peaked in 2016, when nearly 69 percent of respondents reported anticipating high-quality lives in five years — up almost 6 percentage points from 2009, when the country was in the midst of the financial crisis. From 2024 to 2025, Hispanic adults saw a six-point drop in optimism, while white adults saw a 4.6-point decrease and Black adults saw a 2.2-percentage point decline. That comes as President Trump’s immigration crackdown has targeted Hispanic communities nationwide, particularly in Democratic-run cities such as Los Angeles and Chicago. Backlash against the Trump administration’s immigration policies has intensified in the wake of federal immigration officers fatally shooting two U.S. citizens, Renee Good and Alex Pretti, in Minneapolis last month. Meanwhile, optimism among Democrats declined by 7.6 points from 2024 to last year, while it increased by nearly 1 point among Republicans and decreased by 1.5 percentage points among independents. That follows a pattern from 2020 to 2021, when Republicans’ optimism dropped by 5.9 points and Democrats’ optimism rose by 4.4 points as former President Biden took office. With less than eight months before the midterms, Trump and the GOP are battling this drop in optimism — specifically over the state of the economy — and recent historical trends that show the president’s party loses congressional seats two years into his term. “Presidents, whether it’s Republican or Democrat, when they win, it doesn’t make any difference. They seem to lose the midterms,” Trump told conservative talk show host Will Cain on Fox News last month in Iowa. While Trump told NBC News in an interview released Sunday that he is “proud” of the economy, inflation, at 2.7 percent, remains above the Federal Reserve’s target of 2 percent and unemployment rose from 4 percent in January 2025 to 4.4 percent in December 2025. A survey from NPR/PBS News/Marist released last week also found that nearly 60 percent of respondents disapprove of the president’s performance on the economy, an increase of 2 percentage points from the same poll conducted a month prior. The Gallup results are based on four quarterly surveys conducted throughout last year with 22,125 U.S. adults. The margin of error is 0.5 percent for the entire survey, while it is between 1 and 2 percent for race and ethnicity and political identity subgroups.

item.description:
Let's get this bread.
Fight back in the Cherokee language (I believe)
Pippin tax Today's message from Pippin: "What doing? Pippin. Pippin. Pippin." ______ 1) Are you on the run to a safe place and passing through Arizona on your way to safer grounds? My apartment is open to you to crash at, and it is a safe space. Pippin and I will make you a meal and gladly share tea, wine, or mead with you. 2) Hey! Take your meds with a full glass of water, please. Do it for Pippin, or Space Mom, or better yet, do it for yourself. 3) Ĝefeloað wē. We will carry on. 4) all funds from the sales of items at these two links will be sent to support charities aiding to fight for Trans rights in the US (not just T-shirts!) https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74812801-all-conures-are-anarchists https://www.teepublic.com/t-shirt/74811778-whiptail-pride 5) Since multiple people have requested this over the last two weeks or so, my ko-fi is: https://ko-fi.com/codyandpippin

item.title: For those who will enjoy after…
item.description:
#memes #socially_awesome_awkward_penguin Back in August I ordered a vinyl record set for Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. I don’t usually care for the music of a video game, well, halo 3 was fantastic too, but this is different. That game was a masterpiece and the music is no different. No other soundtrack would I listen to actively at work when I’m lesson planning or grading.
#socially_awkward_awesome_penguin I have a small group of friends who played it so not many would appreciate this. My wife doesn’t understand the game so she wouldn’t fully appreciate this.
IT CAME!!!!
I just wanted to share this with you all!
